info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 1:34PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Greensville, southwestern Sussex, southeastern Dinwiddie and northeastern Brunswick Counties and the City of Emporia through 215 PM EDT... At 134 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Radium, or near Purdy, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Emporia, Purdy, Sussex, Jarratt, Stony Creek, Radium, Carson, Bufford Crossroads, Booker, Yale, Pleasant Shade, Lumberton, Wharfs Store, Emporia Reservoir, Cowie Corner, Hilda, Gray, Fields Crossroads, Warfield and Huske. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for south central and southeastern Virginia.
